member.name: Windows.AddPointerInteractionContext
member.summary: Include the specified pointer in the set of pointers processed by the Interaction Context object.
member.param: Handle to the Interaction Context object.
ID of the pointer.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.BufferPointerPacketsInteractionContext
member.summary: Adds the history for a single input pointer to the buffer of the Interaction Context object.
member.param: The handle of the interaction context.
The number of entries in the pointer history.
Basic pointer information common to all pointer types.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.CreateInteractionContext
member.summary: Creates and initializes an Interaction Context object.
member.param: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.DestroyInteractionContext
member.summary: Destroys the specified Interaction Context object.
member.param: The handle of the interaction context.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.GetCrossSlideParameterInteractionContext
member.summary: Gets the cross-slide interaction behavior.
member.param: The handle of the interaction context.
One of the constants from CROSS_SLIDE_THRESHOLD.
The distance threshold of threshold.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.GetInertiaParameterInteractionContext
member.summary: Gets the inertia behavior of a manipulation (translation, rotation, scaling).
member.param: The handle of the interaction context.
One of the constants from INERTIA_PARAMETER.

param.name: value
param.para: The value of inertiaParameter. This value is one of the following:

item.description: The rate of deceleration, in radians/ms².
For translation, the relative change in screen location, in HIMETRIC units.
For rotation, the relative change in angle of rotation, in radians
For scaling, the relative change in size, in HIMETRIC units.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.GetInteractionConfigurationInteractionContext
member.summary: Gets interaction configuration state for the Interaction Context object.
member.param: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.
Number of interaction configurations.
The interactions enabled for this Interaction Context object.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.GetMouseWheelParameterInteractionContext
member.summary: Gets the mouse wheel state for the Interaction Context object.
member.param: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.
The value of parameter.
One of the constants from MOUSE_WHEEL_PARAMETER.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.GetPropertyInteractionContext
member.summary: Gets Interaction Context object properties.
member.param: Handle to the Interaction Context object.
One of the constants identified by INTERACTION_CONTEXT_PROPERTY.

listheader.description: Measurement units are HIMETRIC units (0.01 mm).
Measurement units are screen pixels. This is the default value.
Visual feedback for user interactions is disabled (the caller is responsible for displaying visual feedback). For more info, see Input Feedback Configuration.
Visual feedback for user interactions is enabled. This is the default value. For more info, see Input Feedback Configuration.
Pointer filtering is disabled (all pointer input data is processed).
Pointer filtering is enabled (only pointers specified through AddPointerInteractionContext are processed). This is the default value.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.GetStateInteractionContext
member.summary: Gets current Interaction Context state and the time when the context will return to idle state.
member.param: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.
Basic pointer information common to all pointer types.
One of the constants from INTERACTION_STATE.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.ProcessBufferedPacketsInteractionContext
member.summary: Process buffered packets at the end of a pointer input frame.
member.param: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.ProcessInertiaInteractionContext
member.summary: Sends timer input to the Interaction Context object for inertia processing.
member.param: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.ProcessPointerFramesInteractionContext
member.summary: Processes a set of pointer input frames.
member.param: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.
Number of frames to process.
Number of pointers in each frame.
Pointer to the array of frames (of size entriesCount).

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.RegisterOutputCallbackInteractionContext
member.summary: Registers a callback to receive interaction events from an Interaction Context object.
member.param: Handle to the Interaction Context.
The callback function.
A pointer to an object that contains information about the client. The value typically points to the object for which the member function is called (this).

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.RemovePointerInteractionContext
member.summary: Remove the specified pointer from the set of pointers processed by the Interaction Context object.
member.param: Handle to the Interaction Context object.
ID of the pointer.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.ResetInteractionContext
member.summary: Resets the interaction state, interaction configuration settings, and all parameters to their initial state. Current interactions are cancelled without notifications.Interaction Context must be reconfigured before next use.
member.param: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SetCrossSlideParametersInteractionContext
member.summary: Configures the cross-slide interaction.
member.param: The handle of the interaction context.
Number of parameters to set.
The cross-slide threshold and its distance threshold.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SetInertiaParameterInteractionContext
member.summary: Configures the inertia behavior of a manipulation (translation, rotation, scaling) after the contact is lifted.
member.param: The handle of the interaction context.
One of the constants from INERTIA_PARAMETER.

item.description: The rate of deceleration, in radians/ms².
For translation, the relative change in screen location, in HIMETRIC units.
For rotation, the relative change in angle of rotation, in radianx
For scaling, the relative change in size, in HIMETRIC units.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SetInteractionConfigurationInteractionContext
member.summary: Configures the Interaction Context object to process the specified manipulations.
member.param: The handle of the Interaction Context.
The number of interactions being configured.
The interactions to enable for this Interaction Context object.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SetMouseWheelParameterInteractionContext
member.summary: Sets the parameter values for mouse wheel input.
member.param: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.
The value for parameter.
One of the constants identified by MOUSE_WHEEL_PARAMETER.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SetPivotInteractionContext
member.summary: Sets the center point, and the pivot radius from the center point, for a rotation manipulation using a single input pointer.
member.param: Pointer to a handle for the Interaction Context.
The x-coordinate for the screen location of the center point.
The y-coordinate for the screen location of the center point.
The offset between the center point and the single input pointer, in HIMETRIC units.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SetPropertyInteractionContext
member.summary: Sets Interaction Context object properties.
member.param: Handle to the Interaction Context object.
One of the constants identified by INTERACTION_CONTEXT_PROPERTY.
The value of the constant identified by contextProperty.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.StopInteractionContext
member.summary: Sets the interaction state to INTERACTION_STATE_IDLE and leaves all interaction configuration settings and parameters intact. Current interactions are cancelled and notifications sent as required.Interaction Context does not have to be reconfigured before next use.
member.param: Handle to the Interaction Context object.

returns.para: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK.
Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.
